author: Special Correspondent
text:
A fireman dousing the fire on a cracker unit premises in Mathiyasenai near Virudhunagar on Monday.— Photo: G. Moorthy

Seven workers suffered burns – three of them sustained severe burns – in a fire accident at a cracker unit at Mathiyasenai near here on Monday.

Police said that the friction caused when workers collected pellets used in fancy crackers that were dried up on a drying platform at the cracker unit triggered the fire around 2 p.m.

The employees who were working on the platform were injured. Among them, M. Shanmugathai (45), G. Kolanji (35) and V. Nagappan (55) suffered 75-90 per cent burns.

All the injured were admitted to a private hospital in Sivakasi. However, the three with severe burns were shifted to a private hospital in Madurai.

Virudhunagar Superintendent of Police P. Aravindhan, and District Revenue Officer C. Muthukumaran were among those who inspected the scene.

Amathur police are investigating.
title: Seven injured in fire at cracker unit
